56.review:
Very cool place. My family and I dined here on out last full day while on vacation. We ate.a late lunch, so we got there around 3 PM and they weren’t that busy.

We got seated fairly quickly and our server was very prompt in coming to our table.

We all ordered “The Big Bacon” burger. We all thought it was delicious!

We didn’t spend any time looking at the movie memorabilia, as we had other things to attend after eating, but the items I did see were interesting.

We have no Planet Hollywood near our home, and figured this may be our only chance to dine in one. I’m glad we did!

554.review:
Such a massive disappointment. I can't even review the regular food, because I never got my food(only dessert). There were 7 in my party, and the waitress brought out everyone's orders, but mine (nothing fancy, that would take awhile. Just a chicken sandwich). I waited and waited, finally waved her down to ask, politely, when I might be getting mine (I used to waitress, so I always make sure to be polite). She said she'd go check on it. Waited, waited...about 20 minutes later, when everyone at the table was basically done, I got up and went to find our waitress and asked her to just cancel my order. She just said 'fine', in a tone, as if I was bothering her. Not a single apology. 
We then ordered dessert. I ordered the Planet Meltdown, to share with the group. It was supposed to be a chocolate sphere over a slice of double chocolate fudge cake. There was no cake! The sphere melted to reveal a single scoop of vanilla ice cream. I was just baffled. 
I never really leave negative reviews, but this was just an over the top, bad experience...and being that this was my 40th Birthday dinner, made it sting that much more. 
In addition, my daughter, who ordered their BBQ chicken sandwich, said it was awful. She only ate half of it, and was in bed with stomach pains, most of the following day.
554.name: Abigail Barhorst

636.review:
Four main points to the experience measured out of  5.

Atmosphere - 3 
While the idea behind the restaurant is a good one, the props and costumes providing a strong feel of nostalgia. Overall it comes across a little outdated, bordering tacky. 

Service - 5 
All staff we dealt with were incredibly friendly, giving fantastic advise for things to do in the city. Service was fast and efficient without rushing. Overall, brilliant!

Food - 4
Tasty, plenty, free drink refills. Not Michelin star but you could definitely do a lot worse!

Cost - 4
Cheapest lunch of our little holiday, four people very well fed for well under a hundred dollars. Plenty of bang for your buck!

Overall 4/5, "I'll be back"

I’m a motor coach driver. I dropped off 63 people at Planet Hollywood in Times Square NYC. 

All restaurants give drivers a free meal since we are bringing them bus loads of customers. This location of Planet Hollywood denies my passengers a to go box so they can bring me dinner. 

I’m will not starve due to this, I just think it’s poor business ethics to not show appreciation for bringing in a bus load of people. We can always choose another place to eat. I’m sure the next time we will choose another restaurant next time. One that will be courteous to the drivers that bring them bus loads of PAYING CUSTOMERS! 

I will personally make sure I do not bring any of my passengers here again. I will also spread the word to other coach drivers so if they can avoid this location of Planet Hollywood Times Square they will.
759.name: Rick Beck

966.review: Un lugar que vale la pena visitar si se es fan de las películas de los 90 para atras, ya que hay muchas referencias y artículos a ellas. Los precios son un poco más elevados que la mayoría de los restaurantes, de igual manera si se tiene el sightseeing pass, podes canjear una atracción por 15 dólares en el menú (hasta las 5 PM). Las porciones son normales

967.review: It was fast and the food was delicious but when I got my check my food was $25 and I paid $40 and gave back to him and he came back with my change and I only got like $5 back and I told him that he needed to give me $10 dollars back and he looked at me like an idiot, looked at the ticket and said "ohhhh I am very sorry". So I really didn't mind it much but just make sure you get the right amount of change back.
